submission:
class Solution:
    def can_div(self, number: str, k: int) -> bool:
        cur=0
        for i in number:
            cur=cur*10+int(i)
            cur=cur%k
        return cur==0
    
    def largestPalindrome(self, n: int, k: int) -> str:
        match k:
            case 1:
                return "9"*n
            case 2:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "8"
                    case _:
                        return "8"+"9"*(n-2)+"8"
            case 3:
                return "9"*n
            case 4:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "8"
                    case 2:
                        return "88"
                    case 3:
                        return "888"
                    case _:
                        return "88"+"9"*(n-4)+"88"
            case 5:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "5"
                    case _:
                        return "5"+"9"*(n-2)+"5"
            case 6:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "6"
                    case 2:
                        return "66"
                    case 3:
                        return "888"
                    case 4:
                        return "8778"
                    case _:
                        if n%2==1:
                            return "8"+"9"*int((n-3)/2)+"8"+"9"*int((n-3)/2)+"8"
                        else:
                            return "8"+"9"*int((n-4)/2)+"77"+"9"*int((n-4)/2)+"8"
            case 7:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "7"
                    case 2:
                        return "77"
                    case _:
                        for i in range(9,0,-1):
                            if n%2==1:
                                ans="9"*int((n-1)/2)+str(i)+"9"*int((n-1)/2)
                                if self.can_div(ans,k):
                                    return ans
                            else:
                                ans="9"*int((n-2)/2)+str(i)*2+"9"*int((n-2)/2)
                                if self.can_div(ans,k):
                                    return ans
            case 8:
                match n:
                    case 1:
                        return "8"
                    case 2:
                        return "88"
                    case 3:
                        return "888"
                    case 4:
                        return "8888"
                    case 5:
                        return "88888"
                    case _:
                        return "888"+"9"*(n-6)+"888"
            case 9:
                return "9"*n
            case _:
                return "9"*n
